intro: Asphodelus neglectus, commonly known as the common asphodel, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, grass-like leaves and tall, erect flowering stalks. The plant produces small, pale yellow to greenish flowers arranged in dense, spike-like clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas, along roadsides, and in dry meadows. Asphodelus neglectus is adapted to Mediterranean climates and is known for its resilience to drought and poor soil conditions.
